  1. Description
  2. Classes and Interfaces

Package bcu.cmp5332.bookingsystem.commands

package bcu.cmp5332.bookingsystem.commands
  • Class
    Description
    AddBooking
    A command that creates (issues) a new Booking, potentially specifying seat type and food option.
    AddCustomer
    A command that creates a new Customer record in the system.
    AddFlight
    A command to create a new Flight with separate seat capacities (economy, business, first) plus a base price.
    CancelBooking
    A command that cancels an existing booking.
    Command
    Represents an executable command that operates on the FlightBookingSystem.
    DeleteCustomer
    A command that marks a Customer as deleted so they are excluded from listings.
    DeleteFlight
    A command that marks a Flight as deleted so it no longer appears in flight listings, implementing a soft-delete strategy.
    EditBooking
    A command to update an existing booking to a new flight, with an option to change seat type.
    Help
    A command that prints the static help message defined in Command.HELP_MESSAGE.
    ListBookings
    A command that lists all bookings in the system.
    ListBookingsCustomer
    A command that lists all bookings for a specific customer, identified by their customer ID.
    ListBookingsDate
    A command that lists all bookings made on a specific date.
    ListBookingsFlight
    A command that lists all bookings for a specific flight, identified by flightId.
    ListCustomers
    A command that lists all active (non-deleted) customers in the system.
    ListFlights
    A command that lists all active (non-deleted) flights in the system.
    LoadGUI
    A command that launches the GUI version of the Flight Booking System by creating a new MainWindow.
    NoOpCommand
    A no-operation (NoOp) command, typically used for commands like 'help' that only print information and do not modify the system.
    ShowCustomer
    A command that displays detailed information about a single customer, identified by customerId, including a list of their bookings.
    ShowFlight
    A command that displays details about a specific flight, including seat capacities, base price, deletion status, and passenger list.
